channel.title: My Car Story With Lou Page
channel.description: My Car Story With Lou Page

item.title: A Craigslist Purchase: 1965 Buick Riviera
item.description: From online listing to driveway star, this 1965 Buick Riviera proves some Craigslist finds are pure gems.

media:content.media:title: A Craigslist Purchase: 1965 Buick Riviera
media:content.media:description: From online listing to driveway star, this 1965 Buick Riviera proves some Craigslist finds are pure gems.
media:content.media:credit: My Car Story With Lou Page

item.title: 1969 Plymouth Barracuda 340 Formula
item.description: Packing the 340 Formula V8, this ’69 Barracuda blends compact muscle with big performance—an underrated Mopar classic.

item.title: Roaring into history with the last Superbird!
item.description: One of the final Superbirds produced—this rare piece of Mopar history shows why it remains a collector’s dream.

item.title: Iconic 1970 Superbird in Limelight Green!
item.description: The legendary 1970 Plymouth Superbird shines in rare Limelight Green—a true NASCAR-inspired muscle car built for speed and style.

item.title: This Monkeemobile Had Too Much Torque!
item.description: A closer look at the iconic Monkeemobile, built for the 1960s TV band, and how its powerful setup delivered more torque than expected for a show car.

item.title: Amazing Hand-Painted Dukes Of Hazzard Motor!
item.description: A one-of-a-kind motor painted by hand with a Dukes of Hazzard theme—showcasing bold colors, intricate details, and true custom car artistry.

item.title: This 1973 Chevrolet is Resto Modded
item.description: Old-school looks, modern performance—check out this stunning 1973 Chevy resto mod build.

item.title: 1970 Chrysler 300H Hurst in White n Gold
item.description: A rare 1970 Chrysler 300H Hurst finished in its signature white and gold—showcasing bold muscle car styling and luxury touches that make it a collector’s dream.

item.title: This 1969 Dodge Monaco Station is a Beast
item.description: A closer look at the powerful 1969 Dodge Monaco Station Wagon: an iconic blend of muscle and practicality that still turns heads decades later.

item.title: 1983 AMC Eagle Sport 4x4 Adventure
item.description: The 1983 AMC Eagle Sport blends classic styling with rugged 4x4 capability, making it a muscle car-inspired ride built to handle roads others can’t.

item.title: 1957 or 2003 — Which Ford Thunderbird You Pickin’?
item.description: Two eras, one legend. Do you prefer the timeless lines of the ’57 Thunderbird or the modern revival of 2003?

item.title: 69 Cyclone Spoiler: NASCAR Born.
item.description: A tribute to pure racing DNA—the 1969 Mercury Cyclone Spoiler, built with NASCAR in its bloodline.

item.title: Classic 1955 Chrysler: Ride in Style
item.description: Step back into the golden age of American motoring with this elegant 1955 Chrysler—a perfect blend of luxury, design, and timeless road presence.

item.title: 1958 Buick Special: Yellow & Timeless
item.description: 1958 Buick Special: Yellow & Timeless

item.title: Head-Turning '62 Dodge! Love it or hate it?
item.description: With bold early-’60s styling and classic Mopar character, this 1962 Dodge demands attention—whether you admire its design or find it polarizing.

item.title: Factory 428 Cobra Jet Test Car # 32 of 50 1968 Ford Mustang & Ride
item.description: Number 32 of just 50 built, this 1968 Ford Mustang served as a factory test car for the legendary 428 Cobra Jet engine—offering rare performance and muscle car history in one ride.

item.title: The 1962 Pontiac Catalina
item.description: With bold styling and powerful V8 options, the 1962 Pontiac Catalina embodies early-’60s performance—an icon of Pontiac’s muscle car heritage.

item.title: 1938 Packard Twelve
item.description: A pinnacle of pre-war elegance, the 1938 Packard Twelve blends refined styling with a powerful V12 engine—an enduring symbol of American automotive craftsmanship.

item.title: 2009 Brimstone Quadracycle
item.description: 2009 Brimstone Quadracycle

item.title: Hand-Painted Dukes of Hazzard Engine Art
item.description: A classic motor gets a custom touch with detailed, hand-painted Dukes of Hazzard artwork—blending mechanical power with iconic TV nostalgia.
